Package com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVPhotoController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVPhotoController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class TEVPhotoController
extends Object
    REST controller for working with photos. Uses the RepoAbstractor class in some instances but not in others, because photos work differently from other types of posts.
    Author:
    tiyb

    • Method Detail

      • fixPhotosForBlogForPost

        @GetMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}/fixPhotos")
public Boolean fixPhotosForBlogForPost​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                       String blog,
                                       @PathVariable("id")
                                       String postId)
        The Tumblr export doesn't always include every image, for some reason. However, in many cases the images referred to in the image URLs from Tumblr's export XML still exist on Tumblr's servers. So, in cases where a post is missing its images, this API can be used to fetch the images from Tumblr's servers (according to their URLs in the XML), download them, and save them to the media directory being used by TEV, using the naming convention Tumblr would have used, if the images had been included in the export.
        Parameters:
        blog - Not used
        postId - The ID of the post to be "fixed"
        Returns:
        bool indicating whether the action completed successfully or not.

      • getAllPhotosForBlog

        @GetMapping("/posts/{blog}/photos")
public List<Photo> getAllPhotosForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                       String blog)
        GET request for listing all photos for a given blog. Does not use underlying RepoAbstractor class, since the logic is slightly different than from other post types.
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which photos should be retrieved
        Returns:
        List of all photos in the database

      • createPhotoForBlog

        @PostMapping("/posts/{blog}/photo")
public Photo createPhotoForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                String blog,
                                @Valid @RequestBody
                                @Valid Photo photo)
        POST request to submit a Tumblr "photo post" into the system for a given blog. Doesn't use the abstractor, since logic is different for photos.
        Parameters:
        blog - For validation purposes
        photo - The data to be submitted
        Returns:
        The same Photo object that was submitted

      • getPhotoForBlogById

        @GetMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}/photo")
public List<Photo> getPhotoForBlogById​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                       String blog,
                                       @PathVariable("id")
                                       String postId)
        GET to return the photos for a given post
        Parameters:
        blog - Not used
        postId - The Post ID
        Returns:
        List of photos

      • updatePhotoForBlog

        @PutMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}/photo")
public Photo updatePhotoForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                String blog,
                                @PathVariable("id")
                                String postId,
                                @RequestBody
                                Photo photoDetails)
        PUT to update a Photo
        Parameters:
        blog - not used
        postId - The ID of the post to be updated
        photoDetails - The data to be updated
        Returns:
        The same Photo object that was submitted

      • deleteAllPhotosForBlog

        @DeleteMapping("/posts/{blog}/photos")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAllPhotosForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                                                         String blog)
        DEL to delete all "photo" posts in the DB for a given blog. Because a given Photo post can actually have multiple photos in it, the logic is to retrieve all photo posts for the given blog, then delete each photo for that post.
        Parameters:
        blog - Blog for which photos should be deleted
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the response details

      • deletePhotoForBlog

        @DeleteMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}/photo/{photoId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deletePhotoForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                                                     String blog,
                                                                     @PathVariable("id")
                                                                     String postId,
                                                                     @PathVariable("photoId")
                                                                     Long photoID)
        DEL to delete a single photo by ID for a given blog
        Parameters:
        blog - Not used
        postId - the ID of the post to be deleted
        photoID - The ID of the photo to be deleted
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the response details
